total_revenue.context: Net sales increased 9% to $127.4 billion in the first quarter of 2023, compared with $116.4 billion in Q1 2022. Excluding the $2.4 billion unfavorable impact from year-over-year changes in foreign exchange rates throughout the quarter, net sales increased by 11% compared with Q1 2022.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had an unfavorable impact of $2.4 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America segment sales increased 11% year-over-year to $76.881 billion in Q1 2023.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America increased to $75.983 billion in Q1 2023.

operating_income.context: North America segment operating income was $0.898 billion in Q1 2023, compared with operating loss of ($1.568) billion in Q1 2022.

net_sales.context: International segment sales increased 1% year-over-year to $29.123 billion in Q1 2023, or increased 9% excluding changes in foreign exchange rates.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International increased to $30.37 billion in Q1 2023.

operating_income.context: International segment operating loss was ($1.247) billion in Q1 2023, compared with operating loss of ($1.281) billion in Q1 2022.

net_sales.context: AWS segment sales increased 16% year-over-year to $21.354 billion in Q1 2023.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS increased to $16.231 billion in Q1 2023.

operating_income.context: AWS segment operating income was $5.123 billion in Q1 2023, compared with operating income of $5.205 billion in Q1 2022.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased to $127.358 billion in Q1 2023, up 9% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses increased to $122.584 billion in Q1 2023, up 19% from Q1 2022.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $4.774 billion in Q1 2023, compared with $3.669 billion in Q1 2022.

total_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses for Q1 2023 were $122.584 billion, up 19% from Q1 2022.
key_factors: Investments in fulfillment and transportation infrastructure
Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

COGS.context: Cost of goods sold was $165 million in Q1 2023.

Fulfillment.context: Fulfillment expenses were $603 million in Q1 2023.

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses were $2.574 billion in Q1 2023.

Marketing.context: Marketing expenses were $0.993 billion in Q1 2023.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses were $0.413 billion in Q1 2023.

Other.context: Worldwide shipping costs were $19.937 billion in Q1 2023.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense was $4.748 billion in Q1 2023.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $4.774 billion in Q1 2023, compared with $3.669 billion in Q1 2022.

net_income.context: Net income was $3.2 billion in Q1 2023, compared with a net loss of ($3.8) billion in Q1 2022.

eps.context: Net income of $3.2 billion translates to $0.31 per diluted share in Q1 2023, compared with a net loss of ($0.38) per diluted share in Q1 2022.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow improved to an outflow of $3.3 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $18.6 billion for the trailing twelve months ended March 31, 2022.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased 38% to $54.3 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $39.3 billion for the trailing twelve months ended March 31, 2022.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations improved to an outflow of $10.1 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $29.3 billion for the trailing twelve months ended March 31, 2022.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations improved to an outflow of $4.5 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $22.3 billion for the trailing twelve months ended March 31, 2022.

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures details not provided in the Q1 2023 financial results.

share_repurchase.context: Share repurchase details not provided in the Q1 2023 financial results.

daily_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the Q1 2023 financial results.

monthly_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the Q1 2023 financial results.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) decreased to 1,465,000 in Q1 2023, down 10% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to enhance its market leadership across e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and other innovative sectors.
initiatives: Delivered a record-breaking holiday season with nearly half a billion items purchased from small businesses.
Enhanced Same-Day Delivery speed, with nearly 26 million customers using the service in the quarter, a 50% increase compared to last year.

Expanded U.S. online store selection with new marquee beauty, home, and fashion brands, including Lancôme, Shiseido, World of Martha by Martha Stewart, Rent the Runway, KNOW Beauty by Vanessa Hudgens, and new The Drop collections from Harlem Fashion Row and Coco & Breezy.
Launched a new Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) capacity management system to help sellers manage inventory and capacity efficiently.
Released the third annual Brand Protection Report, highlighting efforts to combat counterfeit products, resulting in over 6 million counterfeit products seized.
Launched Reviews from Amazon, enabling Buy with Prime merchants to display Amazon.com customer ratings and reviews within their own online stores.
Acquired One Medical, a primary care organization offering both 24/7 virtual care services and in-office visits across the U.S.
Announced that Prime Video will exclusively present the first-ever “Black Friday” National Football League game on November 24.
Set box-office records with MGM’s premiere of Creed III, grossing $100.4 million globally in its opening weekend.
Premiered Amazon Original limited series Daisy Jones & The Six, which debuted at No. 1 on Prime Video globally, along with other original films and series.
Won four Ambies, the premier podcasting award, for Amazon Music and Wondery podcasts.

Announced new commitments and migrations from AWS customers, including partnerships with Southwest Airlines, Zurich Insurance Group, BBVA, Broadridge, S&P Global, Snowflake, Stripe, Westpac, T-Mobile, Marvell, TELUS, and Iberdrola.
Expanded AWS infrastructure footprint with new Regions in Malaysia and Australia.
goals: Maintain leadership in e-commerce and cloud services
Expand technological innovations in AI, machine learning, and infrastructure
Enhance customer satisfaction and service offerings
Support small and medium-sized businesses
Drive innovation in health services through acquisitions like One Medical
Strengthen international market presence
Enhance brand protection and anti-counterfeiting efforts
Continue expanding AWS infrastructure and partnerships
examples: Nearly 26 million customers ordered items with Same-Day Delivery, up 50% from last year.
Added new marquee beauty, home, and fashion brands to U.S. online store.
Launched new FBA capacity management system for sellers.
Released Brand Protection Report with over 6 million counterfeit products seized.
Launched Reviews from Amazon feature for Buy with Prime merchants.
Acquired One Medical and integrated its services.
Premiered Daisy Jones & The Six, reaching No. 1 globally on Prime Video.
Expanded AWS infrastructure with new Regions in Malaysia and Australia.
Formed new AWS partnerships with major companies like Southwest Airlines and Zurich Insurance Group.

innovation.description: Amazon is focused on innovation across its platforms including AWS, Alexa, Prime Video, and new hardware devices to enhance customer experience and operational efficiency.
initiatives: Enhanced Same-Day Delivery speed and launched a Zero Carbon certified site.
Premiered Amazon Original limited series Daisy Jones & The Six and other original content.
Launched AWS Regions in Malaysia and Australia.
Expanded the AWS Partner Network with new collaborations.
Hosted Amazon Accelerate, introducing new tools for seller success.
goals: Provide advanced security and database services through AWS
Enhance user interaction with Alexa
Expand digital content offerings globally
Improve smart home security solutions
Develop autonomous and cloud-based technologies
Foster customer-driven product development through innovative programs
Introduce innovative payment solutions with Amazon One and Venmo
Enhance in-vehicle entertainment and connectivity
Integrate Alexa with multiple voice assistants on single devices
Increase advertiser and agency engagement with real-time marketing insights
examples: Enhanced Same-Day Delivery with a Zero Carbon site.
Launched Daisy Jones & The Six on Prime Video.
Expanded AWS infrastructure with new Regions.
Hosted Amazon Accelerate introducing new email marketing and shipping software.

acquisitions.description: Amazon continues to grow through strategic acquisitions to enhance its product and service offerings.
initiatives: Acquired One Medical, integrating its services into Amazon's health offerings.
Filing legal action against orchestrators of fake reviews to protect brand integrity.
goals: Strengthen market position in key sectors
Enhance technological capabilities and service offerings
Accelerate growth in digital media and content
Expand health services through acquisitions like One Medical
examples: Acquisition of One Medical, adding primary care services to Amazon's health offerings.
Legal actions against more than 11,000 websites and social media groups orchestrating fake reviews.

ecosystem_development.description: Amazon is expanding its ecosystem through the introduction of new services and partnerships to enhance customer engagement and satisfaction.
initiatives: Delivered a record-breaking holiday season with nearly half a billion items purchased from small businesses.
Enhanced Same-Day Delivery speed and expanded availability.
Premiered Daisy Jones & The Six, reaching No. 1 on Prime Video globally.
Launched Reviews from Amazon for Buy with Prime merchants.
Announced new commitments and migrations from AWS customers.
Expanded AWS infrastructure with new Regions in Malaysia and Australia.
Formed new AWS partnerships with companies like Southwest Airlines, Zurich Insurance Group, BBVA, Broadridge, S&P Global, Snowflake, Stripe, Westpac, T-Mobile, Marvell, TELUS, and Iberdrola.
goals: Increase convenience and innovation in retail
Enhance digital streaming offerings and partnerships
Expand AWS services and regional availability
Integrate Alexa into more consumer devices and vehicles
Drive innovation in gaming and entertainment through Prime Video and AWS
Expand contactless and secure delivery options
Enhance brand analytics and marketing effectiveness with Amazon Marketing Stream
examples: Record-breaking holiday sales.
Same-Day Delivery enhancements.
Daisy Jones & The Six reaching No. 1 on Prime Video.
Reviews from Amazon for Buy with Prime merchants.
AWS customer migrations and infrastructure expansions.

social_initiatives.description: Amazon is committed to supporting its employees and communities, especially during challenging times.
initiatives: Delivered a record-breaking holiday season supporting small businesses.
Certified a Same-Day Delivery site as Zero Carbon.
Offering industry-leading pay and benefits to employees.
Creating jobs through Amazon Fresh and fulfillment network expansions.
Legal actions against fake review orchestrators.
goals: Ensure the safety and well-being of employees
Maintain operational continuity during crises
Support communities and essential workers
Provide industry-leading pay and benefits
Foster long-term innovation and strategic growth
Expand international job creation and fulfillment capabilities
Protect customers and brands from counterfeit and fraudulent activities
examples: Supporting small businesses with nearly half a billion items purchased.
Zero Carbon Same-Day Delivery site.
Industry-leading pay and benefits.

Legal actions against fake review orchestrators.

revenue_growth.expectation: Net sales are expected to be between $127.0 billion and $133.0 billion, or to grow between 5% and 10% compared with second quarter 2022.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Excluding the unfavorable impact of approximately 30 basis points from foreign exchange rates.
factors: Continued strong performance during Prime Day and Prime Early Access Sale
Increased demand for online shopping and AWS services
Expansion of Prime Video and other subscription services
Growth in AWS infrastructure and service offerings
Launch of new services like Amazon Pharmacy and Amazon Fresh
Successful integration of Just Walk Out Technology in additional grocery stores
Innovations in shopping experiences and expansion of fulfillment network productivity
revenue_growth.specifics: Q2 2023 revenue guidance includes specific revenue and earnings expectations, assuming Prime Day occurs in the second quarter.

leadership_transition.description: Jeff Bezos, Amazon founder and former CEO, transitioned to the role of Executive Chair in Q3 2021, and Andy Jassy became Chief Executive Officer at that time.
leadership_transition.context: Jeff Bezos stepped down to focus on long-term strategic initiatives and innovation, while Andy Jassy, head of AWS, took over as CEO to lead Amazon's continued growth.
